descript.abstract: The Federal Aid Urbanized Area Boundaries database is a geographic database of Federal-aid boundaries for urban areas with a population greater than 50,000. The database includes boundaries for urban areas in all 50 states, the District of Columbia, and Puerto Rico.
descript.purpose: The data provide users with information aboutthe locations, names, urban, census and FIPS codes, and size of urban areas primarily for national planning applications.

idinfo.useconst: For Non-commercial use only. Acknowledgment of the Bureau of Transportation Statistics National Transportation Atlas would be appreciated in products derived from these data
idinfo.datacred: The Federal-Aid Urbanized Area Boundaries files were compiled from a variety of sources including the US Bureau of the Census, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration National Ocean Service, and data supplied by State Departments of Transportation. The data sets were created and standardized by members of the Geographic Information Systems Laboratory, Pellissippi Research Institute, The University of Tennessee, Knoxville.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows NT Version 4.0 (Build 1381) Service Pack 6; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.1.1.649

attracc.attraccr: Attributes for the Adjusted Urbanized Area database are created in a consistent manner with a similar tolerance. Other attributes in the Adjusted Urbanized Area database were taken from the Highway Performance Monitoring System Field Manual Appendix B. All area and distance calculations are calculated to the nearest 50m.

dataqual.logic: All node-link and polygon topological relationships were created and verified using computer algorithms. Uniqueness of entity IDs were similarly verified by computer algorithm.
dataqual.complete: 399 distinct Adjusted Urbanized Areas (AUB) are identified in this database. Six (6) Urbanized areas are enclosed within the boundaries of other AUBs and are not defined.

horizpa.horizpar: The positional accuracy of each data set varies as described. The Adjusted Urbanized Area database was created from data which had scale of 1:100,000 or better and as such has a positional accuracy of +/- 80m. The shorelines for the 23 coastal states were created using 1:250,000 NOS digital data which has a positional accuracy of +/- 200m. Thus, all internal political boundaries have a higher accuracy than do the coastal definitions with the exception of Alaska.

citeinfo.title: Adjusted Urbanized Area maps and Data, State DOT's.

srcinfo.srccontr: Spatial information for federally adjusted urban area boundaries.

citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Ocean Service.
citeinfo.title: NOS D-Scale Digital Shoreline Files, Version 1, Feb. 1992.

procstep.procdesc: The original shape file was imported to an ArcSDE Layer.

All state supplied maps were digitized using ARC/INFO V6.1x. All State supplied digital data was converted to ARC/INFO using a variety of encoding methods. The state databases were appended and adjusted to correct minor geodetic problems. After attributes were added and the data set checked for completeness and accuracy it was extracted from ARC/INFO and reformatted into ASCII data files.

After completing topological and attribute verification using ARC/INFO, the data was extracted and reformatted into the BTS ACSII format, and converted into shape file format and redundant fields were eliminated.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier for the geographic entity - the Urbanized Area Code
Centroid longitude value for the polygon expressed in decimal degrees.
Centroid latitude value for the polygon expressed in decimal degrees.
Describes the original source of the NAME attribute data in the polygon record
An approximation of the area of the Urbanized Area in square miles.
An approximation of the area of the Urbanized Area in square kilometers.
A descriptive name for the geographic entity - the Urbanized Area Name Polygons in the data set that are not part of an urbanized area contain a series of 'XX's in this version.
The Census assigned Urbanized Area Code for the adjusted urbanized area.
The SHAPE attribute is a data attribute inherent to the ESRI shapefile format. It defines the vector data as point, polyline or polygon.

edom.edomvd: A "Polygon" is an area feature comprised of points and line segments.

overview.eadetcit: GIS Group, (1994) "National Highway System Polygon Databases: Data Schema and File Structures", Report prepared for the Federal Highway Administration, HEP-11 by the Pellissippi Research Institute, University of Tennessee, Knoxville.
